prob_desc_description: You are given two positive integers $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^9$$$) and $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \le k \le 100$$$). Represent the number $$$n$$$ as the sum of $$$k$$$ positive integers of the same parity (have the same remainder when divided by $$$2$$$).In other words, find $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_k$$$ such that all $$$a_i>0$$$, $$$n = a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_k$$$ and either all $$$a_i$$$ are even or all $$$a_i$$$ are odd at the same time.If such a representation does not exist, then report it.
prob_desc_output_spec: For each test case print:   YES and the required values $$$a_i$$$, if the answer exists (if there are several answers, print any of them);  NO if the answer does not exist.  The letters in the words YES and NO can be printed in any case.
prob_desc_input_spec: The first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 1000$$$) â€” the number of test cases in the input. Next, $$$t$$$ test cases are given, one per line. Each test case is two positive integers $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^9$$$) and $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \le k \le 100$$$).
source_code:
t = input()
t = int(t)
while t > 0 :
    line = input()
    i = line.split()
    x = int(i[0])
    y = int(i[1])
    o = x - (y-1)
    if o%2==1 and o>0 :
        print('YES')
        for j in range(y-1) :
            print('1', end = " ")
        print(o)
        t = t-1
        continue
    e = x - (y-1)*2
    if e%2==0 and e>0 :
        print('YES')
        for j in range(y-1) :
            print("2", end = " ")
        print(e)
    else :
        print("NO")
    t = t - 1
